alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 9:12AM EDT until July 16 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Chester County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 115 PM EDT. * At 912 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... West Chester, Westtown, Paoli, Radnor Township, West Goshen, Malvern, Devon-Berwyn, and Chesterbrook. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
